Question: On Click of RadioGroup how to Show Preference: :I would like to create a list of RadioButtons to click on a Preference. I did the radio buttons in this way:<RadioGroup>       <Preference android:key="ex" android:summary="Example" android:title="Example"/>    <RadioGroup            android:id="@+id/radioSex"            android:layout_width="wrap_content"            android:layout_height="wrap_content" >            <RadioButton                android:id="@+id/radioMale"                android:layout_width="wrap_content"                android:layout_height="wrap_content"                android:text="@string/radio_male"                 android:checked="true" />            <RadioButton                android:id="@+id/radioFemale"                android:layout_width="wrap_content"                android:layout_height="wrap_content"                android:text="@string/radio_female" />        </RadioGroup>After, in the Java filePreference ex;ex = (Preference) this.findPreference("ex");ex.setOnPreferenceClickListener(new OnPreferenceClickListener() {});After this I do not know how to do. You can post a code to click on the preference displays a list of radio buttons? Thank you very much
Please using this api: TypedArray.getString.
Answer:
response:
<<<api>>>: TypedArray.getString(int index)
<<<code>>>: 
```
ex.setOnPreferenceClickListener(new OnPreferenceClickListener() {
    @Override
    public boolean onPreferenceClick(Preference preference) {
        AlertDialog.Builder builder = new AlertDialog.Builder(context);
        builder.setTitle("Choose an option");

        // Create a list of radio buttons
        final String[] options = new String[]{"Option 1", "Option 2", "Option 3"};
        final int[] checkedItem = {0}; // Default selected item index

        builder.setSingleChoiceItems(options, checkedItem[0], new DialogInterface.OnClickListener() {
            @Override
            public void onClick(DialogInterface dialog, int which) {
                checkedItem[0] = which;
            }
        });

        builder.setPositiveButton("OK", new DialogInterface.OnClickListener() {
            @Override
            public void onClick(DialogInterface dialog, int which) {
                // Get the selected option
                String selectedOption = options[checkedItem[0]];
                // Do something with the selected option
                Toast.makeText(context, "Selected option: " + selectedOption, Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show();
            }
        });

        builder.setNegativeButton("Cancel", null);

        AlertDialog dialog = builder.create();
        dialog.show();

        return true;
    }
});
```
<<<explanation>>>: 
- Set an `OnPreferenceClickListener` on the `Preference` object `ex`.
- In the `onPreferenceClick` method, create an `AlertDialog.Builder` to display a dialog with a list of radio buttons.
- Define an array of options for the radio buttons.
- Define an array `checkedItem` to keep track of the selected item index.
- Use `builder.setSingleChoiceItems` to set the list of radio buttons. Pass in the options array, the initial checked item index (`checkedItem[0]`), and an `OnClickListener` to handle the selection.
- Use `builder.setPositiveButton` to set a positive button with a click listener. In the click listener, get the selected option using `options[checkedItem[0]]` and perform any desired actions.
- Use `builder.setNegativeButton` to set a negative button (optional).
- Create and show the dialog using `builder.create().show()`.
- Return `true` to indicate that the click event has been handled.
